channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: フォックスとAEGが、2025年3月31日から1週間にわたる大学バスケのポストシーズン・トーナメントを発表。
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Fox and AEG announce a week-long post-season college basketball tournament starting on March 31, 2025, as media companies devise sports events they control  —  Does the sports world have room for April Action after weeks of March Madness?  —  Fox aims to answer the question in 2025 …

item.title: 米ロックバンド、キッスがスウェーデンのエンターテインメント会社Pophouseに音楽、名前、イメージ、肖像権の権利を売却し、ライブショーを制作、関係者によると～3億ドル（Daniel Thomas/Financial Times）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
US rock band Kiss sells rights to its music, name, image, and likeness to Swedish entertainment company Pophouse to create a live show, a source says for ~$300M  —  Sale to Swedish entertainment group Pophouse set to 'fulfil the band's vision to become immortal'

item.title: Substackは購読者ではなくフォロワーを重視し、有料購読をプラットフォームから移行するための不透明なステップを踏んでいるため、ライターにとって離脱が難しくなっている（Andrea Grimes/Home With The Armadillo）
item.description:
Andrea Grimes / Home With The Armadillo:
Substack's new emphasis on followers, not subscriptions, and its opaque steps to migrate paid subscriptions off the platform make leaving harder for writers  —  And it'll be worse this time around!  —  The writing life, which has never exactly been a picnic for independent journalists and freelancers …

item.title: 20億ドルの価値があると推定されるオーストラリアの大ヒット子供向けテレビアニメ番組「ブルーイ」の成功を見てみよう。
item.description:
Devin Leonard / Bloomberg:
A look at the success of Bluey, the hit Australian animated TV show for kids estimated to be worth $2B, whose future is uncertain after the third season ends  —  The Australian children's show auteur Joe Brumm is at a crossroads: Keep growing, or end one of the best runs on TV.

item.title: 米国で最後の独立系書籍販売会社のひとつであったSmall Press Distributionの突然の閉鎖を受け、小規模書籍出版社は心配している（Adam Morgan/Literary Hub）
item.description:
Adam Morgan / Literary Hub:
Small book publishers worry following the abrupt closure of Small Press Distribution, which was one of the last independent book distributors in the US  —  Adam Morgan Talks to Small Press Publishers About What Happens Next  —  Last week, Diane Goettel was on vacation in Florida when she saw an alarming email on her phone.

item.title: X、2024年の総選挙に向けてインドでコミュニティ・ノート投稿サポートを展開、現在69カ国に投稿者がいると発表（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
X rolls out support for posting Community Notes in India ahead of the 2024 general elections and says the program now has contributors in 69 countries  —  Weeks before the national elections in India, Elon Musk-owned X said it is rolling out support for posting Community Notes — the company's crowd-sourced fact-checking program.

item.title: Xは、2,500人以上の "verified subscriber followers "を持つアカウントに無料のPremiumステータスを与える計画の一環として、ジャーナリストを含む一部のアカウントにブルーチェックを追加した（Amrita Khalid/The Verge）。
item.description:
Amrita Khalid / The Verge:
X adds blue checks to some accounts, including journalists, as part of its plan to give free Premium status to those with 2,500+ “verified subscriber followers”  —  Just as Elon Musk said, X is doling out free Premium and Premium memberships to accounts with a high number of verified followers.

item.title: テッド・クルーズ米上院議員、自身のポッドキャストを主催するiHeartMediaが、自身の再選を確実にするためだけに存在するPACに2023年に63万ドル以上を提供したとの報道に反論（Shannon Ryan/ABC13）
item.description:
Shannon Ryan / ABC13:
US Sen. Ted Cruz pushes back against reports that iHeartMedia, which hosts his podcast, gave $630K+ in 2023 to a PAC that exists solely to ensure his reelection  —  Sen. Ted Cruz is facing questions over a tangled web of political contributions involving the company that airs his podcast.

item.title: アップル、4月3日に1時間以上続いたApp Store、Apple TV、Podcasts、Musicなどオンライン・サービスの一部に影響を与えた障害を解消（Richard Lawler/The Verge）
item.description:
Richard Lawler / The Verge:
Apple resolves an outage impacting some of its online services, including the App Store, Apple TV, Podcasts, and Music, that lasted for over an hour on April 3  —  Apple's online services were hit with an outage that cut many of us off from the App Store, Apple TV, and Apple Music on Wednesday night.

item.title: 2022年にサンタイムズを買収したシカゴ・パブリック・メディアがレイオフを発表、公共ラジオ局WBEZの組合員コンテンツ制作者62人のうち15％近くを削減（Dave McKinney/WBEZ Chicago）
item.description:
Dave McKinney / WBEZ Chicago:
Chicago Public Media, which bought the Sun-Times in 2022, announces layoffs, cutting nearly 15% of 62 unionized content creators at public radio station WBEZ  —  The move to terminate nearly 15% of 62 unionized content creators at WBEZ and four people at the Chicago Sun-Times comes amid …

item.title: 情報筋Apollo Global Managementは先週末、Paramountに対し、Apolloが260億ドル以上での完全買収に関心を持っていると伝えたが、Paramountは関心を示さなかった。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Apollo Global Management told Paramount over last weekend that Apollo was interested in acquiring the full company for $26B+; Paramount did not engage  —  Paramount's board of directors, which was already deep into talks with the media company Skydance, didn't engage with the offer.

item.title: グルーポ・テレビサはAT&Tが保有するスカイ・メキシコの株式を2027年と2028年に買い取る予定。スカイのルイス・マルビドCEOは4月15日に退任し、フランシスコ・ヴァリムが後任となる（Andrea Navarro/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Andrea Navarro / Bloomberg:
Grupo Televisa plans to buy out AT&T's stake in Sky Mexico, payable in 2027 and 2028; Sky CEO Luis Malvido will leave on April 15, replaced by Francisco Valim  —  - Companies did not disclose an amount for the transaction  — The stake will be paid in 2027 and 2028, Televisa added

item.title: 情報筋National Amusementsを通じてパラマウント・グローバルの支配株主であるシャリー・レッドストーン、スカイダンス・メディアへの株式売却で暫定合意（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Sources: Shari Redstone, Paramount Global's controlling shareholder through National Amusements, reaches a tentative deal to sell her stake to Skydance Media  —  - Redstone is the controlling shareholder of Paramount  — Ellison's Skydance has partnered with Paramount on films

item.title: Newsflash、CEN、AsiaWire、Clipzillaを含む30人の従業員を抱えるマイケル・ライディヒの通信社ネットワークが、委託予算の減少を理由に閉鎖（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
Michael Leidig's news agency network, which employs 30 and includes Newsflash, CEN, AsiaWire, and Clipzilla, shuts down, citing a fall in commissioning budgets  —  Michael Leidig blames fall in commissioning budgets and newsroom AI for difficulties.  —  A news agency network that employs 30 people …

item.title: 情報筋Paramount取締役会とSkydance Mediaが独占的合併協議に合意、Paramountは他の入札者との協議を一時停止、PARAは～15％上昇（Jessica Toonkel/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Jessica Toonkel / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Paramount's board and Skydance Media agree to exclusive merger discussions, and Paramount will pause talks with other bidders; PARA rises ~15%  —  Agreement paves the way for an exit by controlling shareholder Shari Redstone  —  A deal between Paramount and Skydance is potentially one step closer to happening.
